intro: Neurolaena tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf false nutsedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of ponds. Neurolaena tenuifolia is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
